title: Drawing, Project for an Altar, ca. 1575
medium:
pen and brown ink
support: off-white laid paper on secondary paper support
inscribed: At lower edge: Notisi ch latare si poi alungar sino alla letera A  A come è signato co il lapis.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: In the central part above the mensa is a sepulchre with the body of a Saint. In front of the second story of the retable is a reliquary box with a cherub between two cornices turned outside on top. Above is a triangular pediment with two obelisks and a cross. In the panels beside the mensa are two "A"s. At right is the left part of a door, below the scale.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Project for an Altar, ca. 1575. pen and brown ink
support: off-white laid paper on secondary paper support. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1040.
